intro: Canthium dundusanense, commonly known as the Dundus mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. Canthium dundusanense is often found in rocky soils and thrives in areas with high sunlight exposure.
